page.title: 20 The Beauty of Old England
page.content: Flora and fauna abound in this heavily wooded and rural area.Violets,wood anemones,bluebells,campions and countless other varieties of flowers.Dozens of woodland paths wander through areas of woodland and coppicing.Sweet chestnut and silver birch are common and oak,ash,beech and alder as well as patches of conifer.Red wood ants build their nests in many of the woods.Insect life is everywhere and field and woodland birds abound.We heard a nightingale sing.We saw a fox and suspected badgers in the woods.With the ancient Pilgrims Way and many bridleways the tired town or city dweller can walk or ride through some of the most attractive countryside in England.It is soft,matured,gentle countryside now,after centuries of toil from man,but satisfying and very safe.
